snippet: Before beginning deliberations on Tuesday, jurors in Roger Clemens’s perjury trial heard starkly different summations of a case that highlights the drug problems in baseball and other sports.
abstract: Federal prosecutors press for a conviction during closing arguments in the perjury trial of Roger Clemens, saying it is obvious that Clemens lied to Congress about his performance-enhancing drug use; Clemens's lawyers insist that the government has failed to prove its case beyond a reasonable doubt.
lead_paragraph: Before beginning deliberations on Tuesday, jurors in Roger Clemens’s perjury trial heard starkly different summations of a case that highlights the drug problems in baseball and other sports.

headline.seo: Prosecution and Defense Make Final Arguments in Clemens Case
headline.main: After Contrasting Closing Arguments, Clemens Jurors Are ‘Final Umpires’
headline.print_headline: After Contrasting Closing Arguments, Clemens Jurors Are ‘Final Umpires’
